result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor Darvell McKnight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court orders all costs, surcharges and DNA surcharge to be paid by 09-21-2016 or a civil judgment be entered. Court orders a DNA sample.

With credit for 247 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Concurrent with: any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor Darvell McKnight

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Court sentences defendant to serve 90 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 247 days, concurrent to any other sentence, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders all costs and surcharges to be paid by September 21, 2016 or a civil judgement be entered.

Court orders a DNA sample and DNA surcharge to be paid by September 21, 2016.

20 day appeal rights given.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed. 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; received and filed.

Defendant Victor Darvell McKnight in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Victor Darvell McKnight in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY of Disorderly Conduct 947.01 (no modifier). Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION FOR PURPOSES OF THE JURY TRIAL IN BRANCH 31.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Victor Darvell McKnight not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced from the House of Correction for purposes of this hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed with Jury Trial set for 03-21-2016 at 09:00 am in Branch 31.

Defendant Victor Darvell McKnight in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial dates in Branch 31. All parties are notified that effective 12-1-15 this case will be assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Victor Darvell McKnight not in court, in custody and not produced.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Final pre-trial conference held. Case remains calendared for jury trial on November 30, 2015 at 9:00 a.m., Branch 37.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Victor Darvell McKnight not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Defense counsel requests jury trial date. Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision INCLUDING ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.G.R. (8/30/2000) AND KFC, 1570 W MITCHELL ST., MILWAUKEE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Victor Darvell McKnight in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Victor Darvell McKnight in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
